info.description:
Lets developers to automate a set of actions required for application lifecycle and extend our platform functionality by combining with other services.
Using our API you can programmatically create environments, deploy apps and perform other tasks that could be earlier accomplished only via Virtuozzo Application Platform dashboard but not limited to them.
Virtuozzo Application Platform API follows REST principles. REST API determines a set of functions which can be requested by a developer, who then receives a response.
The interaction is performed via HTTP protocol. The advantage of such method is a wide extension of the HTTP protocol. That's why REST API can be used from almost any programming language.

Redeploys containers to a different tag (learn more in the documentation).

nodeGroup.description: unique identifier of the target node group (layer), e.g. "cp" for the default application server layer.

tag.description: target tag for the container redeploy.

isSequential.description: defines whether to redeploy containers one-by-one to ensure uptime (true) or simultaneously (false).

useExistingVolumes.description: defines whether to keep existing volumes data (true) or erase any custom data (false).

delay.description: delay (in seconds) between two consecutive redeploys when using the sequential restart type (I.e. when redeploy is performed on servers one-by-one to ensure uptime).

login.description: new username to access remote registry.

password.description: new password to access remote registry.

manageDNSState.description: defines whether to exclude a target node from DNS for the duration of the operation (true) or not (false, by default). This parameter only works with the sequential processes (isSequential=true) and is ignored otherwise. Enabling the parameter will bring additional delay (as the DNS records have TTL and cannot be disabled instantly), while disabling can cause some of the requests to be lost.

post.description: Creates a personal access token, which allows executing specific API methods.

tokenTemplate.description: one of standard tokens configurations with the predefined permissions (Marketplace, Maven Plugin, IDE Plugins, Extended Access). You can get the full list with the "GetTokenTemplates" method. If not specified, a "Custom" token with manually provided "apiList" will be created.

apiList.description: a comma-separated list of API methods that are allowed by the token. You can get the full list with the "GetTokenApiList" method. For example: ["env.control.CreateEnvironment", "env.control.RedeployContainersByGroup", "env.file.AddMountPointByGroup"].

expiresAt.description: expiration date (UTC) for the token. In the format “yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss”, e.g. "2022-11-16 00:00:00".

delay.description: delay (in seconds) between two consecutive restarts when using the sequential restart type (I.e. when restart is performed on servers one-by-one to ensure uptime).

manageDNSState.description: defines whether to exclude a target node from DNS for the duration of the operation (true) or not (false, by default). password.description: password or token for authentication in VCS.

autoupdate.description: defines whether to enable (true) or disable (false) automatic project updates (only upon code changes in the remote repository); auto-update frequency is set with the interval parameter.

interval.description: delay (in minutes) for automatic project updates.

autoResolveConflict.description: defines whether to automatically resolve (true) or not (false) merge conflicts (by updating the contradictory files to the repository version, i.e. locally made changes are discarded).

zdt.description: defines whether to use zero-downtime deployment for PHP (true) or not (false).

updateNow.description: defines whether to deploy your project immediately after its creation (true) or postpone this operation (false).

nodeGroup.description: unique identifier of the target node group (layer), e.g. "cp" for the default application server layer.

hooks.description: JSON object with custom scripts (actual content) to be executed before and after the build/deployment operations. For example: {"preDeploy":"script", "postDeploy":"script", "preBuild":"script", "postBuild":"script"}.

delay.description: delay (in seconds) between two consecutive deployments when using the sequential deployment type (i.e. when deployment is performed on servers one-by-one to ensure uptime).

post.description: Returns resource consumption statistics for the specified environment. Average consumption for each interval of the given period is provided.

duration.description: period (in seconds) to show statistics for.

interval.description: interval (in seconds) to divide the stated period (duration).

endtime.description: end time (UTC) in the format “yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss”, e.g. "2022-11-16 00:00:00" (duration must be passed).

nodeid.description: unique identifier of the target node (container).

nodetype.description: unique identifier of the target node type (software stack), e.g. “tomcat11” for the Tomcat 11 stack. Required if nodeid is not specified.

nodeGroup.description: unique identifier of the target node group (layer), e.g. "cp" for the default application server layer.

envName.description: source environment name (with a build node).

context.description: custom context name for the deployed project (ROOT by default).

post.description: Returns a list of logs for the specified environment's load alert triggers execution.

triggerId.description: unique identifier of the target load alert trigger.

actionTypes.description: a semicolon-separated list of triggers' action types (for filtering) (supported values: NOTIFY, NOTIFY_OOM).

startTime.description: start time (UTC) of a period for which actions should be shown. In the format “yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss”, e.g. "2022-11-16 00:00:00".

endTime.description: end time (UTC) of a period for which actions should be shown. In the format “yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss”, e.g. "2022-11-16 00:00:00".

startRow.description: returns information starting from the specified row in the response (starts with 0, by default).

resultCount.description: returns the specified number of rows from the response (10 by default).

orderField.description: sorts results by the specified field.

orderDirection.description: sorts results in the ascending (ASC) or descending (DESC) order.

skipResults.description: skips results with matching text (for filtering).

nodeGroup.description: unique identifier of the target node group (layer), e.g. "cp" for the default application server layer.

resourceTypes.description: a semicolon-separated list of triggers' resource types (for filtering).

triggerLogId.description: unique identifier of the target log file.

hooks.description: JSON object with custom scripts (actual content) to be executed before and after the build/deployment operations. For example: {"preDeploy":"script", "postDeploy":"script", "preBuild":"script", "postBuild":"script"}.

delay.description: delay (in seconds) between two consecutive deployments when using the sequential deployment type (i.e. when deployment is performed on servers one-by-one to ensure uptime).

post.description: Deploys Java project to the target environment.

post.description: Returns a list applications in user's personal "Favorite" category of the Marketplace.

appid.description: unique identifier of the application for which the session was created (optional).

search.description:
JSON object with the search parameters. For example (all fields are optional): 
{
 "name": "string | string[]",
 "categories": "string | string[]",
 "jpsType": "string",
 "nodeType": "string",
 "nodeGroup": "string",
 "dockerOs": "string",
 "guestOSType": "string",
 "dockerName": "string",
 "dockerTag": "string",
 "count": "number",
 "offset": "number"
}

checksum.description: checksum of the Marketplace applications (to verify that you possess the most recent checksum and applications copy). If you send the same 'checksum' parameter as received in the previous response and if this 'checksum' hasn't changed on the server side, then the server assumes you have the latest local copy of applications on the client side. In this case, it will return an empty applications list, speeding up the response time.

envGroup.description: target group name or JSON array of group names.

post.description: Removes (unbinds) SSL certificates from the environment or specific external domains.

extDomains.description: a comma-separated list of external domains to be unbound (if not specified, SSL certificates are unbound from the environment).

buildNodeId.description: unique identifier of a Maven build node (for Java-based projects only).

delay.description: delay (in seconds) between two consecutive deployments when using the sequential deployment type (i.e. when deployment is performed on servers one-by-one to ensure uptime).

post.description: Redeploys container(s) to a different tag (learn more in the documentation).

nodeGroup.description: unique identifier of the target node group (layer), e.g. "cp" for the default application server layer.

nodeId.description: unique identifier of the target node (container).

tag.description: target tag for the container redeploy.

useExistingVolumes.description: defines whether to keep existing volumes data (true) or erase any custom data (false).

login.description: new username to access remote registry.

password.description: new password to access remote registry.

manageDNSState.description: defines whether to exclude a target node from DNS for the duration of the operation (true) or not (false, by default). This parameter only works with the sequential processes (isSequential=true) and is ignored otherwise. Enabling the parameter will bring additional delay (as the DNS records have TTL and cannot be disabled instantly), while disabling can cause some of the requests to be lost.

If you send the same 'checksum' parameter as received in the previous response and if this 'checksum' hasn't changed on the server side, then the server assumes you have the latest local copy of applications on the client side.
